group_1.textRight: Naaaaaayuuuuutaaaaan!

group_1.textLeft: Mi-Mikage…!
It's embarrassing to have people@shouting at my door...

group_1.textRight: I'm here to help you get ready@for the party!
Did you guys already finish?

group_1.textLeft: No, not yet, but we had to put things@on hold for a while...

group_1.textRight: Something wrong?

group_1.textLeft: We'll catch a cold if we stand out here@like this. Come inside and I'll explain.
Speaking of which, what are you two...?

group_1.textRight: We're here as part of a Christmas campaign.
Fumuuu!
They're the Three Wise Men of the East!

group_1.textLeft: My goodness! Free Coordinations!
That would be splendid.

group_1.textRight: We're pleased you like the gift.
So what's up, Nayutan?

group_1.textLeft: Oh?

group_1.textRight: You said you had to put hold on@the preparations.

group_1.textLeft: Oh yes, that... This is the cause.

group_1.narration: ―Mikage―@Woaaah! What's this?@There's candy spilling out of this stocking!
―Nayuta―@When I returned home from school today,@I found it all at my doorstep.
―Mikage―@It's a Christmas present!@I'm so happy for you, Nayutan!
―Nayuta―@But...the sender's name is@not written upon it.

group_1.textRight: What?!
A bounty of sweets from an unknown sender...@It raises some flags.

group_1.textLeft: There's another thing to be suspicious of.

group_1.textRight: What's that?

group_1.textLeft: The treats are all beautifully wrapped,
and furthermore, homemade.

group_1.textRight: I didn't even realize! I thought they were@done by a professional...
And there's so much of it, too...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, we've counted a total of thirteen kinds of homemade sweets. It must have been a lot@of work to make.
The wrapping paper is carefully numbered@from zero through twelve.

group_1.textRight: Thirteen kinds... Perhaps it has@something to do with Christmas.
The number thirteen is beginning@to seem ominous,
as it's often mentioned as a bad portent@in Western culture and mythology.
And confectionery number twelve is...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, you've noticed...
Wh-what is it?
Wh...what...?

group_1.textRight: Macarons are notoriously difficult@to make manually.
It's quite the technical feat...@Not something a mere hobbyist would do.

group_1.textLeft: Th-this is all quite unsettling...
Thirteen homemade treats, their origins unknown@save for the giver being incredibly skilled...
I-I am so frightened...I can't die yet...

group_1.textRight: ...Should I dispose of them?

group_1.textLeft: Well, no, that's...
If it truly is a gift, I would feel awful.

group_1.textRight: Fumufufunmumunfumufumumu@fumuuumufumu.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I totally agree, Sutan!

group_1.textRight: Yes, Sudachi's take is somewhat@more grounded.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:103801:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]That settles that, then! Yippee!
No, no, I don't want this to mark@the death of all three of us...

group_1.textRight: She was just saying someone might've@left them at your house by mistake.

group_1.textLeft: Left them by mistake...
You have a point; it's possible this gift@was not intended for me.
There is no address...so it could very well@have been misplaced.
Even so, this is still not good...
It means there is someone waiting@for this gift.
The person who made these must have someone@they were determined to deliver them to.
I want to see if we can find the recipient@by Christmas.

group_1.textRight: *Sigh* If that's the case,@then I guess we might as well...
I wish we could at least get@the correct address...
Fumu, fumumunfu.
Yes, that's right; it's a good thing@it's Christmas, Sudachi.

group_1.textLeft: What...?

group_1.textRight: Please leave it to us Coordinators.@We will help you free of charge.
